name: St. Louis Union Station - a DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel

reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency was a wonderful place to stay. The customer service at the front desk was excellent, the maids were great, the room was very nice, and my family and I had a wonderful experience. The only negative thing would be that the prices were too high for the breakfast buffet (16.50) and alcoholic drinks were also expensive. Overall, this hotel was outstanding and I would highly recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

likes.disliked: — prices on food and drinks inside the hotel

reviews.text: I was unsure about choosing this hotel because of many of the reviews on this website. However we were very pleased. My mother and my children stayed at the Hyatt Regency for two nights. We got a AAA promo rate of $151.20 per night.
reviews.title: Really glad we tried it !!! Great Hotel !!!!

likes.liked: — Great Rooms; close proximity to union station (connected); comfy beds

reviews.text: They are working on the front of the hotel. We pulled up at parked. The doorman was very kind and told us where we can park after we check in. Parking is $14 per day or valet for $24 per day. We head in and my children and mother loved the lobby. So did I. It was beautiful. My mother became very fascinated with the history of the hotel. We check in. The lady who helped me had a very underwhelming persona in the kindness realm. She wasn't rude but didn't greet us with a smile or real kind word. She was efficient and pulled our reservation right up. However she failed to mention some important info. She handed us our room key and never asked us if we were parking in the lot. This is important because you have to get your discounted parking ticket at the front desk. I first heard of this when I read the sign as we were pulling into the lot after we had already checked in. Once we found our room I went to the front desk again. This other lady was very kind and helped me, and said that the other person should have explained this to me. Oh well no biggie. She was very apologetic and actually bothered to smile at the customers she helped.
reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt

likes.liked: — Location to the MetroLink, mall, restaurants.

reviews.text: Ok now for the room. We stayed in #3018. We loved it. Just a quick walk down the hall and to the elevator and we were in Union Station. You have to use your room key to get back in to the gates that are at each level so as to only allow hotel guests back in . We were so close to Einstein bros bagels. They have the best coffee. This was wonderful in the morning. We were just a few minutes from the parking lot and our car across the street.
reviews.title: Destination & Conference Hotel

likes.disliked: — No breakfast, free internet, or phone calls

reviews.text: For meals we enjoyed the food court in Union Station. We also ate dinner at Hard Rock Cafe at Union Station. It was delicious. We also enjoyed the little chocolate shop. Wonderful. I know that this review is of the hotel but I can't say enough about how wonderful it was to just walk down from our room and be right there.
reviews.title: great hotel in a great location

likes.liked: — comfortable quiet rooms in a busy location
likes.disliked: — gated entrance to room area was separate from check in area

reviews.text: I stayed for one evening in the Hyatt Downtown St. Louis on business. Overall very pleased with the hotel. The lobby is situated in the grand room of St. Louis Union Station - it is an incredible space, monsterously high ceilings, gorgeous inlays, paintings, etc. There's a bar right in the middle of it. Check in was easy (self service kiosk) and everyone was very friendly.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Great Location, Fantastic Lobby Setting

likes.disliked: — The lounge chair in the room (it wasn't dirty, just ugly)

reviews.title: Big mall should be separated from hotel
reviews.text: Room - bed was super comfortable. Bathroom was nice, I liked the Portico amenities, but the shower curtain wasn't quite up to par. Not dirty, just not a luxury looking curtain. Room size is average, the lounge chair was a bit ugly. But overall, those are nit-picky things, the room was good.

Service - first rate. I had internet problems, the tech came up within minutes and waived the fee because I had to go through the inconvenience of calling him to fix the wiring. Bell staff and front desk very efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Average for a Hyatt Regency

reviews.text: Food - only had breakfast there, but it was good.
reviews.title: Historic!

likes.disliked: — walking to gym and pool through the mall

reviews.text: Location - this is the place to be; right near most everything you need to be downtown, although the Arch and the river would be quite a long walk (like 16 blocks). And being in Union Station, there's all kinds of cool shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Fun
Lacklustre
reviews.text: Stayed here on business, which was unfortunately not well accommodated by this hotel. Had a King Room on the 4th Floor which was quite large with an entry foyer, bedroom and bathroom. With two beds it would have been quite comfortable for a family. The room had a slight musty smell and the air conditioner was not up to the job of dispelling the late September heat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a number of oddities to this hotel: on entry you need to carry your luggage up a grand staircase – undoubtedly there is an elevator, but it is not well marked; the exterior of the hotel rooms was not designed to blend in to the historic character of Union Station; and the business centre cannot facilitate printing from the hotel’s internet.
reviews.title: Great Character and Location!
Okay
reviews.text: The one good feature that should be noted is that 2 Apple computers are provided in the lobby to allow guests to view and print their email. However, being Apples, that meant that there were no Microsoft Office programs to open attachments, but still a nice guest service.
While this is a 3 star hotel, it gets 2 star rating due to charging for internet usage (and the lacklustre business centre).
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

likes.liked: — Historical Value and service, employee friendliness

reviews.text: We booked a room at the Hyatt Union Station for one night, as we were in town for a Cards game. Got it through Priceline for an unbelievable $50 plus tax. I was psyched, because I have always wanted to stay here, but could never justify it since we live just across the river in IL and never have a reason to stay over. So, this was our opportunity! Hooray! We are so glad we did. The grand hall lobby alone is worth the price of admission. I would pay $50 just to sit in here all day--seriously! It's THAT gorgeous. Our room was so lovely. Plush linens and amenities. The toilet is separated by a small wall in the bathroom, which provides some extra privacy. Our window looked onto the lush courtyard. We ordered room service at a ridiculous hour, and it was delivered hot and with a smile. There are several dining options in the Union Station complex, and the Metro is right there, so no need to hoof it around town. If you happen to be killing time in your posh room, find the channel that gives the history of the station and hotel. It was really interesting! Overall, a great experience. Thanks, Hyatt, for giving two overworked parents a lovely night out.
reviews.title: True Customer Service

likes.liked: — the bed was the most comfortable!
likes.disliked: — the distance from the fom entry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel seemed to have been recently renovated. The furnishings and bedding were wonderful. The only negative was the bathroom area was small. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised with the Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about staying at this Hyatt after reading so many negative reviews. I booked a room on Priceline for $65 plus tax for a Saturday night. When we checked in, the concierge told us that were upgraded to a Club Room that provided a complimentary breakfast and evening snacks. The "club" rooms are in the main part of the hotel, and we're really very nice, worth of the three or four star rating. The breakfast had nice fresh fruits with their pastries, and the evening snacks had good coffee and tasty veges. Overall I was impressed, especially for a room that only set me back $65/night. We parked on the street that weekend for free, so saved some change there. And for any visitor to St. Louis, the grand hall lobby with its beautiful green tiling and stenciling is worth seeing.
reviews.title: great value, beautiful hotel

likes.liked: — the beauty of the hotel and the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is kind of special - our daughter was conceived here. ;)
reviews.title: Great Hotel, love Union Station

likes.disliked: — They didn't have our room ready when we arrived.

reviews.text: We love Union Station - its great fun and nice to have it available right at your hotel. Landrys Seafood is hear so is the Hard Rock. So we ate well this weekend. We were sorry we didn't get a chance to swim, there is a pool but we ran out of time. The room was the best part. Very cozy and warm. The bed was wonderful!
reviews.title: 21st Century Features in a 19th Century Railroad Station

likes.liked: — Computers in lobby for check-in, check-out, airline check-in, and area information
likes.disliked: — Lengthy line to buy a newspaper at the sundry shop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was a 21st Century experience, as I inserted my credit card into a kiosk to retrieve my reservation (but with a helpful hotel employee at my side in case the computer menus were confusing). I checked out with the same kiosk, receiving a receipt that was much more legible and clear than the average hotel receipt. Nearby were a computer and printer dedicated to checking into airline flights onlline and printing out boarding passes. I'd never seen that kind of (very convenient) set-up before this stay. A few feet away was a computer (with adjacent printer) that reverted to a sort of home page with links to search for restaurants and other attractions. Keeping in mind a 3-minute time limit, that computer was also a way for me to check e-mail.
reviews.title: Worth the stay!

aka: St. Louis Union Station Marriott Hotel Saint Louis
description: The legendary Union Station Hotel in St. Louis, MO, is in the center of St. Louis and within walking distance to Scottrade Center, Peabody Opera House, MetroLink and within minutes from Busch Stadium, Gateway Arch, Edward Jones Dome, America's Convention Center, and City Museum. The hotel is only 20 minutes from Lambert International Airport and has direct MetroLink access to the airport.
